Academic Integrity Having academic integrity means acting fairly and honestly when engaging in academic activities. Cheating, plagiarizing and inappropriate copying of textbooks are examples of [LINK: https://library.conestogac.on.ca/academic-integrity/i-am-a-student/accused-of-misconduct#types-of-misconduct] To learn more: Book a consultation Test your knowledge via the [LINK: https://h5pstudio.ecampusontario.ca/content/73552] Complete the [LINK: https://conestoga.desire2learn.com/d2l/home/230614] in eConestoga Review Conestoga's [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/about/corporate-information/policies?gclid=CjwKCAjw3K2XBhAzEiwAmmgrAkAVNsJyh0byAnFsEbFK3mRCmI-KiBIq73zhbsN6Hzc7mQo7VIi9khoCzK4QAvD_BwE] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/docs/Detail/286] [LINK: /s/academic-integrity/appointments] You can book an appointment with us to learn how to practice academic integrity and avoid future incidents. We can also help you understand the Academic Integrity policies and procedures. Come prepared with details about your academic integrity question or offence. Arrive on time. We will only wait 10 minutes, after which you forfeit your appointment. We recommend students with multiple incidents to book an appointment with us. If no appointments are available, email [LINK: mailto:AcademicIntegrity@conestogac.on.ca] with the subject "Need a consultation appointment". Include your full name, student number, and your preferred meeting time and we will try to accommodate your request. Please be advised that our staff are only available Monday to Friday, 8:30 am - 4:00 pm ET. Please note you will only see appointments if you are a student eligible for service. 11 appointments still available. [LINK: /s/academic-integrity/appointments] ​How does the Academic Integrity Office work? Our office is an educational resource for students. We seek to promote a culture of integrity and academic excellence through educating students of the academic integrity policies, procedures and expectations. The Academic Integrity Office is a neutral party concerning all academic incident cases and is neither an advocate for students or faculty, nor a decision-maker in the investigation process. Our staff can: Help you understand types of academic incidents. Recommend next steps, resources and other services like writing and learning skills available for further support. Answer questions you have related to citing and referencing (e.g. APA@Conestoga). Academic integrity consultation guidelines Appointments are 40 minutes and available on a first-come, first-served basis. Appointments are based on staff availability and are not guaranteed. Appointments must be made at least two days in advance and not more than two weeks in advance. You can access up to one appointment per week. Please ensure you cancel or reschedule your appointments with 24 hours or more notice. If you fail to do so it will be marked as a missed appointment. Frequently missed appointments may impact your ability to self-book service appointments in the future. If you do not arrive within the first 10 minutes of your appointment, your appointment will be marked as missed. [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/academic-integrity/about] Visit [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/academic-integrity/about] for more information about academic integrity and its procedures, penalties and supports.

Accessible Learning & Testing Services Conestoga College provides support and academic accommodation for students with all types of disabilities in keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code. We work with you to understand the impact of your disability in the college environment and develop a plan that considers your goals and the options available to support your full participation in the learning environment. If you are not already registered with Accessible Learning and are looking to discuss possible academic accommodations, please fill out the [LINK: https://conestogac-accommodate.symplicity.com/public_accommodation/] and check out [LINK: https://studentsuccess.conestogac.on.ca/myLearning/NewToAccessibleLearning] If you are already registered with Accessible Learning, request an appointment with your Accessibility Advisor to: Change or renew academic accommodations Address a concern about your academic accommodations being met/support with advocacy Discuss bursaries Accommodations Academic accommodations are managed through the [LINK: https://conestogac-accommodate.symplicity.com/] system. In Accommodate, students can access accommodation letters, request appointments, and more. If you have questions about Accommodate, view the how-to videos below or contact us: [LINK: mailto:accessibility@conestogac.on.ca ] Read more about [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/faqs/detail/93/disability-related-accommodati] . Accommodate: Overview and Logging in Alternate formats of this video: [LINK: https://youtu.be/5X8EFddOcjg?si=vil7Kgp1i9wwhHrp] [LINK: https://youtu.be/Nc5bPkHpYvg?si=IgNz6vTMitncDO_8] Accommodate: Requesting an Appointment Alternate formats of this video: [LINK: https://youtu.be/xPFv7IxmuKc?si=UiL6_MYORAryXplI] [LINK: https://youtu.be/9f75Qic0pWk?si=psu-T7hDCAR9dEJ2] Accommodation Letter After your intake appointment with your Accessibility Advisor and accommodations have been put in place, you will receive an accommodation letter. A copy of this letter will also be delivered to your faculty. If you aren’t sure if you have accommodations in place, please check the expiry date on your most recent accommodation letter (in Accommodate, under ‘Accessibility Emails’). If you are in a co-op work term and registered in a course starting with COOP, your accommodation letter will not be issued. You will receive emails when faculty have viewed and acknowledged your accommodation letter. If you experience a change in course instructors, please let your Advisor know, as the system will not pick up this change. Please also let us know if you do not receive your accommodation letter or emails that faculty have received it. Accommodate: Accessing and Signing your Accommodation Letter Alternate formats of this video: [LINK: https://youtu.be/6p7o4DT3ehs?si=WiWk2ZpEJOLpEeRy] [LINK: https://youtu.be/Vw7RiwCE2ng?si=zoVcPRiOkRmnvCCa]

Assistive Technology Book a consultation to explore technology that helps you read, write, study and learn more effectively. Here are some examples of learning technology software: Text-to-speech: speaks everything on a computer screen Voice recognition: allows the user to say commands and to enter text using their voice Mind-mapping: organizes your ideas through web diagrams and creates visual concept links Assistive Technology and supports Students with referrals from [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/accessiblelearning] can access alternate format services and assistive device trial loans. [LINK: /s/assistive-technology/appointments] Our team helps students by: Identifying areas where [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/learningtechnology] more effectively Providing one-on-one training and support on various [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/at-overview] that help with reading, writing, note-taking and more. Providing access to [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/alternate-formats] for students with documented print disabilities. Important consultation details: Appointments are 40 minutes and available on a first-come, first-served basis. Appointments are based on staff availability and are not guaranteed. Appointments must be made at least two days in advance and not more than two weeks in advance. You can access up to one appointment per week. Please ensure you cancel or reschedule your appointments with 24 hours or more notice. If you fail to do so, it will be marked as a missed appointment. Frequently missed appointments may impact your ability to self-book service appointments in the future. If you do not arrive within the first 10 minutes of your appointment, your appointment will be marked as missed. Please note you will only see appointments if you are a student eligible for service. 44 appointments still available. [LINK: /s/assistive-technology/appointments] Our Services Technologies to help you learn Learn more about [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/learningtechnology] . All students can book an appointment to explore these technologies that can help you learn more effectively. [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/reading] [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/writing] [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/voice-dictation] [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/mind-mapping] [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/note-taking] [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/org-time] [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/math] Assistive technologies Students registered with [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/accessiblelearning] can book an appointment to explore assistive technology to support their learning. [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/17] Browse assistive technologies: [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/20] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/19] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/21] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/22] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/18] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/23] Alternate formats Students registered with [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/accessiblelearning] can book an appointment to learn how to obtain alternate formats of their required course materials and library resources. Visit this library website for more information on how to [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/assistive-technology/alternate-formats] .

CARE Team The Conestoga College CARE Team helps to ensure that the students that are most in need of elevated levels of support are identified early. We aim to provide students with the appropriate opportunities and interventions to aid them in achieving their academic and personal goals, while supporting a safe and welcoming learning environment for all community members. Reasons for a Referral You can refer a student when: A student tells me they are depressed A student shares that they are thinking about or have attempted suicide A student tells me they are or were in the hospital due to mental health and/or illness A student threatens to harm others or themselves [LINK: https://conestogac-advocate.symplicity.com/care_report/index.php/pid225058?] CARE Referral As a member of the Conestoga community, you can share concerns for students by using the [LINK: https://conestogac-advocate.symplicity.com/care_report/index.php/pid832994?] . Only members of the CARE Team review the information you provide. If you have concerns about confidentiality, please write your concern in the referral form. [LINK: https://conestogac-advocate.symplicity.com/care_report/index.php/pid225058?] [LINK: https://conestogac-advocate.symplicity.com/care_report/index.php/pid225058?] A member of the CARE Team will review your referral within 1-2 business days and will contact you by email to confirm the information provided, ask any additional questions, and plan next steps. Who is the CARE Team? The CARE Team includes Conestoga staff members from across the college who have experience in student support, wellness and community safety. This includes staff from Student Health & Wellness, International Office, Residence Operations, Student Rights and Responsibilities, Security Services, and the Dean of Students Office. Other Resources Do you have questions about your courses or program? Book an appointment with a [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-success-advising] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-success-advising] Do you have questions about your visa/post-graduate work permits? Book an appointment with [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/internationalstudentimmigrationadvising] Do you have questions about your tuition payment or fees? Email [LINK: mailto:mailto:%20studentfees@conestogac.on.ca] [LINK: mailto:mailto:studentfees@conestogac.on.ca] Sexual and Gender-Based Violence Prevention and Support: [LINK: https://studentsuccess.conestogac.on.ca/health-and-wellness] Are you in Crisis and need urgent support ? Please contact Security and/or the following resources: Suicide Crisis Helpline (all of Canada): 988 HERE 24/7 (Kitchener, Waterloo, Cambridge, Guelph):1-844-437-3247 Good 2 Talk (Post-secondary student helpline): 1-866-925-5454 or text GOOD2TALKON to 686868 Crisis Support Peel (Mississauga, Brampton, Peel areas): 1-888-811-2222 FAQs Q: What happens after I submit a CARE Referral Form? A: A member of the CARE Team will review your referral within 1-2 business days and will contact you by email to confirm the information provided, ask any additional questions, and plan next steps. Q: Will a CARE Referral impact my immigration status or academic status? A: No. We are here to help students navigate concerning behaviours and to make sure they are connected to the appropriate resources. Q: Can I be anonymous when submitting a CARE Referral Form? A: Please include your contact information in the referral form so that the CARE Team can follow up with you. If you choose to be anonymous, it is not guaranteed that CARE Team can follow up with the student of concern. Q: Will I get in trouble if I submit a CARE Referral Form about my friend? A: The CARE Team is here to help students. When our team hears from you about a concern, we review it carefully and help find the right ways to support. Q: I am stressed about a lot of things happening in my life but don’t know where to get help. Can I submit a CARE Referral Form? A: Review the Other Resources in the section above. If none of these resources help with your concerns, fill out a CARE Referral Form.

Student Ask for Help - Advising Contact Instructions : Please tell us generally about how we can help. Note : Form submissions will be visible to the student and employees supporting student success. Personal information unrelated to the request or of a sensitive nature should not be included on the form . Typical response time: 3 - 7 business days To book an appointment with your Student Success Advisor (SSA) and view their drop-in schedule, visit the [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/appointments/app/topic/83?siteId=1] . For concerns about well-being, mental health or behavioural issues, please submit a [LINK: https://studentsuccess.conestogac.on.ca/faculty/careteam] . Student Number (required) Campus Any Brantford Cambridge - Fountain Street Cambridge - Reuter Guelph Ingersoll Skills Training Centre Kitchener - Downtown Kitchener - Doon Milton Stratford Waterloo Program Name (required) Academic Concerns Please indicate the general concerns by selecting from the following list, then specify the scope of the issue in the textbox below. Absences Academic Integrity College not meeting my expectations Co-op, field placement, or hands on learning Deadlines / tests Failing, withdrawing or discontinued Further education after this Interactions with peers in my classes Learning strategies and skills Scheduling issues Understanding college in Canada Registration concerns Other Personal Concerns Your form submission will be reviewed by a member of the Student Success Advising team. When it comes to personal matters, we can assist you with finding the right support to meet your needs. In some cases, that might be general assistance by a member of our team, and in others we may help you connect with a specialist in another department who can go into more detail. If mental health is central to your current situation, please consider a Care Team referral linked above. Career plans and long-term goals Finances, tuition and student fees Housing or living arrangements Job issues or seeking employment Community or sense of belonging Disability or accessibility Health or well-being Interpersonal relationships (friends, roommates, family, etc.) Work permits or study visas Other Additional Information (required) Please provide clarification about your concerns to help us connect you with the appropriate support. For your privacy, do not include sensitive personal information. Save draft Submit

Contact – Student Success Portal For assistance with services on the Student Success Portal , please visit the specific service site from the HOME landing page. Each service will have unique contact information and methods that you can use to reach the service directly with your questions.

Conestoga College collects personal information from students under the legal authority of the Ontario Colleges of Applied Arts and Technology Act and ensures the personal information is managed in compliance with the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act in order offer students a comprehensive program of career-oriented, post-secondary education and training. The purpose of the Student Success Portal is to provide students with one shared system that enables students to self-book appointments with a variety of service teams at the College. As such, service teams will create consultation notes for students to review. These may include appointment notes and recommended actions. Students can also access resources and request assistance via forms within the system where to ensure the relevant information can be used to support students in a timely and effective way. Students participating in Events & Activities are acknowledging the sharing of their information for the purposes of tracking booking, attendance and follow-up activities by college services and opportunity providers. Conestoga protects personal information and only discloses it as required by law. If you have any questions, please reach out to [LINK: mailto:privacy@conestogac.on.ca] . By accepting these terms, you consent to the Student Success Portal and the information sharing provisions within it.

Student Success Advising No matter your campus or program, there is a Student Success Advisor (SSA) available to support you. We help with academic policies and procedures, navigating the college, setting goals for success, and accessing services. If you don't know where to go, start with an SSA! [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-success-advising/appointments/app/topic/83?siteId=13] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/49] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/Form.aspx?id=3652170] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-success-advising/resources] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-success-advising/resources] What is a Student Success Advisor? [LINK: /s/student-success-advising/appointments] We are located at every Conestoga campus, virtually and in-person. Use the [LINK: https://stuconestogacon.sharepoint.com.mcas.ms/sites/WhoismySSA?e=1:70cb87aa9a074485aa2774a60efd0e5a&CT=1704997539954&OR=OWA-NT&CID=3c7bedc2-c16d-6ed5-5d8d-9115604669c4&WSL=1] to identify who your advisor is, then book an appointment with them. If no appointments are available with your SSA, complete the [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/form.aspx?id=3652170] and they will contact you directly. Please note you will only see appointments if you are a student eligible for service. 21 appointments still available. [LINK: /s/student-success-advising/appointments] SSA Drop-In for Quick Questions You can meet with your SSA for a brief one-on-one to have your quick question answered. Each SSA is available at 1pm available on a first-come, first-served basis. Depending on the day, drop-in may be virtual or in person. A quick question is often related to "how something works", or "where to find" something. If you need a plan for getting back on track, or to review which courses to take, please book an appointment. Next step: enter the [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-success-advising/appointments/app/?workGroupIds=2&siteId=13] and view your SSA's hours and locations (we offer a mixture of virtual and in-person options). How We Can Help Student Success Advisors assist you through your academic journey by coaching, supporting and guiding you to set and meet academic goals. We can help you with: Planning for your academic program with reference to your [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/handbook/student-guide] Understanding college systems, policies, procedures and processes Implementing strategies for making informed decisions and achieving your goals Accessing referrals to academic, wellness, and personal support resources Check-in with your SSA at least once a semester to make sure you are meeting your program requirements, and review the consultation notes after every meeting through your [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-success-advising/dashboard] College Resources ACADEMICS [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/handbook] [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/admissions/registrar-office/academic-dates] [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/handbook/student-guide#AcademicPoliciesAndProcedures] [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/admissions/registrar-office/student-forms] REGISTRATION [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/current-students] [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/current-students/new-students] [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/current-students/returning-students] [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/electives] FINANCES [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/student-financial-services/osap-and-aid] [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/student-financial-services/osap-and-aid] Tips for Success

International Student Immigration Advising International Student Immigration Advisors (ISIAs) are Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultants (RCICs) or Regulated International Student Immigration Advisors (RISIAs). They are available to guide students and provide information to ensure international student compliance relating to studying and working in Canada. International Student Immigration Advisors are available by booking a one-on-one appointment or attending a drop-in session with other students. Find your assigned ISIA by using [LINK: https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=OjndTYrpBESEH8S-zdklpdpdkjT6afJIqFr5RLQV4jxURDNPVDZKVllJQzVEVVdTU0NMOURCV1Y2RS4u] . New appointment times are added on a daily basis. If there are no available appointments or the available times do not fit with your schedule, check back again tomorrow for more options. International Transition Services International Transition Coordinators (ITCs) provide specialized support to international students prior to departure from their home country and during their period of adjustment to Canada and Conestoga College. We assist with housing, settlement, acculturation, as well as provide guidance on accessing important college and community resources. Please email [LINK: mailto:mailto: internationaltransition@conestogac.on.ca] if you have questions. [LINK: /s/international-transition-support/appointments] Book an appointment with one of our International Transition Coordinators (ITCs) for help with: Pre-arrival travel and planning Housing search Navigating college and community supports and resources Cultural adjustment and settlement Safety and well-being If no appointments are available, email [LINK: mailto:mailto:internationaltransition@conestogac.on.ca] with the subject "Need an ITC Appointment". Include your full name, student number, program, and whether you are a full- or part-time student. Please note you will only see appointments if you are a student eligible for service. 2 appointments still available. [LINK: /s/international-transition-support/appointments] International Support Services The [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/international/student-support] webpage has useful information for international students embarking on studies at Conestoga College. You will find resources on Orientation, housing, travel, transportation, cost of living estimates, and links to events and webinars on a variety of topics of importance and interest to students. Information Sessions and Webinars International Transition Coordinators host online events and webinars designed to address the unique needs of international students. Visit [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-engagement/experiences/skills/providers?page=0&keywords=International] on the Student Success Portal (keyword: International) for the latest offering from Conestoga International. Pre-Arrival and Travel Information If you are planning to travel to Canada, please read each section of the Conestoga International [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/international/student-support/travel-to-canada ] carefully. This plan includes important information on preparing for your arrival and transition to Canada and Conestoga College. Register for one of our upcoming [LINK: https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_kDgxySLdRb6JaVsZOqsF1w] webinars. This session provides information on required documents and advice on how to plan for your travel and arrival in Canada. Housing Start your housing search as early as possible once you receive your visa. Find and securing long-term accommodation takes time. Prior to departing your home country, be sure to have a place to stay upon arrival in Canada (temporary and/or long-term). Visit our [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/international/student-support/housing] to learn more about the Canadian housing market, short-term and long-term housing options, estimated rental costs, how to search for housing and more. Your First Days in Canada Check out our list of [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/resources/search/?order=Relevance&topicsUseAnd=true&topics=International%20Student] for information on important tasks you will need to tend to once you arrive in Canada like arranging transportation, setting up your mobile network, opening a bank account, getting a bus pass, accessing health services, and more. You can also check out this [LINK: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLG_bXxTyZqB1wlXrXDWRrvrxDtxPyrGTr]

Indigenous Services Be-Dah-Bin Gamik, a Place of New Beginnings With the support of Elders, we named Indigenous Services Be-Dah-Bin Gamik. This  phrase translates to a Place of New Beginnings, representing the physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual work we do to embody the teachings that come with holding space for new beginnings. We provide academic and cultural services and support for Indigenous students at Conestoga, including First Nations (status and non-status), Métis, and Inuit. Students reconnecting to their Indigenous identities can attend our events and access Be-Dah-Bin Gamik services. Non-Indigenous students are welcome to attend our campus-wide community events and workshops in collaboration with various departments. For more information, visit [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/indigenous] or email Indigenous Services at [LINK: mailto:mailto:bedahbingamik@conestogac.on.ca] . Our Commitment to Indigenous Students At Be-Dah-Bin Gamik, we support Indigenous students through culturally informed services and programs as well as prioritize land-based supports. Be-Dah-Bin Gamik is where Indigenous (First, Nations, Metis, and Inuit) students, college employees, and their guests can gather to study, access technology, and socialize. We live in relationship with the land through teaching gardens, land-based teachings, and increased access to land-based activities. By integrating Indigenous knowledge and practices into all aspects of college life, we empower Indigenous students to thrive and shine on campus and within their communities. [LINK: /s/indigenous-services/appointments] Current students can book an appointment with our Indigenous student wellness advisor or email [LINK: mailto:jhill1@conestogac.on.ca] . Please note you will only see appointments if you are a student eligible for service. no appointments are currently available. [LINK: /s/indigenous-services/appointments] Bursaries & Scholarships Bursary and scholarship information is shared via our social media accounts. We host workshops each term to help students  with the application process. Programming Elders in Residence Every week, Elders from various nations share their Indigenous wisdom, skills, language, and cultural heritage with students. Workshops & Land-Based Education We provide various Indigenous-led workshops and learning opportunities in a welcoming environment that encourage connecting with others and enhances your college experience. Weekly Lunches Join us every Wednesday for a free warm lunch in a community setting—no registration needed. Be-Da-Bin Gamik Locations Kitchener - Doon Campus: 2A601 (main level, A wing) ( [LINK: https://mcas-proxyweb.mcas.ms/certificate-checker?login=false&originalUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww-assets.conestogac.on.ca.mcas.ms%2Fdocuments%2Fwww%2Fabout%2Fcampuses%2Fkitchener-doon%2Fkitchener-doon-main-building-floor-plan-2.pdf%3FMcasTsid%3D15600&McasCSRF=f474c6ca41e8e0234023c1f16e708744166ecdd42c660c396a63909d372cec7e] ) Waterloo Campus: 1F08 (beside Tim Hortons) ( [LINK: https://mcas-proxyweb.mcas.ms/certificate-checker?login=false&originalUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww-assets.conestogac.on.ca.mcas.ms%2Fdocuments%2Fwww%2Fabout%2Fcampuses%2Fwaterloo%2Fwaterloo-floor-plan-1.pdf%3FMcasTsid%3D15600&McasCSRF=f474c6ca41e8e0234023c1f16e708744166ecdd42c660c396a63909d372cec7e] )

Student Rights & Responsibilities Conestoga students have the right to learn in a safe environment, voice their opinions, and appeal a decision when one feels that they did not get a fair process. They also have the responsibility to know what is expected of them, communicate thoughtfully, and respect others. Our department is uniquely positioned to help navigate the intersection of people and their various backgrounds and the conflicts that can sometimes arise, while holding students to a high standard of personal responsibility and upholding the Student Rights and Responsibility policy. Reasons to Contact Us Reach out to our office if you are seeking a resolution to any of the following types of concerns: Conflicts involving students:  If you have problems with another student that make learning hard or if conflicts happen outside of class or group work. Issue with full participation in the student experience: If you face barriers that stop you from fully joining in college activities. Bullying, Harassment, and Discrimination: If you are being bullied, harassed, or discriminated against, or if you see it happening and want help addressing it. Fair treatment: If you believe college policies were not applied fairly or have questions about procedural fairness. Student Expectations for Online Engagement: If you need information about respectful and responsible behaviours for online learning environments according to [LINK: https://www-assets.conestogac.on.ca/documents/www/about/policies/student-affairs/student-expectations-for-online-engagement.pdf] [LINK: https://www-assets.conestogac.on.ca/documents/www/about/policies/student-affairs/student-expectations-for-online-engagement.pdf] If you are unsure, please reach out and we will direct you accordingly. How to Seek Support If you have any questions about your student rights and responsibilities or our processes, you can email us at [LINK: mailto:srr@conestogac.on.ca] . Please include your student number, use your Conestoga email address, and give a summary of your concerns and questions so we can help you better. If you would like to report an incident , you can complete our [LINK: https://conestogac-advocate.symplicity.com/public_report/index.php/pid925408?] . Include as much information as possible. This helps us prepare to support you and direct you to the most appropriate resources. *Note: Filling out the form does not always start a formal resolution process. We will contact you to gather more information and work with you to determine the most appropriate next steps. We respect your privacy and will not take any action without your consent. Our Guiding Principles Community and Respect: Conestoga values respect. Students should share their opinions and debate in a way that protects safety, dignity, and other’s rights. Fairness and Procedural Integrity: Our department aims to be fair and clear in our processes. We help students in understanding on their responsibilities and other college policies. Empowering students: We believe in empowering students to resolve conflicts and learn from them. Whenever possible and appropriate, we encourage informal resolution through open dialogue or mediation, allowing you to co-create resolutions. Safety: We believe that students have the right to feel physically and emotionally safe while on campus. We use a trauma informed approach to support students from a wholistic lens. This means that we understand the impact of a student’s mental, physical, social, emotional and spiritual health on their overall academic success and interactions with others. By understanding how trauma affects them, we aim to create a safe and supportive place while working with students. Developmental Approach: We are a commitment to supporting students in their personal and academic growth. We see our responses to incidents as chances to learn and improve. Other Resources Are you in an emergency and need immediate support? If you are on-campus reach out to Security Services at one of their desk locations or call at 519-748-5220 ext.3357. For support off-campus call dial 911 for police. Have you been found in violation of [LINK: https://library.conestogac.on.ca/academic-integrity/i-am-faculty-administrator/policy-documents] ? – The [LINK: https://library.conestogac.on.ca/academic-integrity/i-am-a-student] can provide you support on next steps and insights on the policy. Book an appointment on [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/academic-integrity] Do you have questions about your courses, program, or timetable? Book an appointment with a [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-success-advising] Do you have questions or concerns about your tuition payment or fees? Email [LINK: mailto:mailto:%20studentfees@conestogac.on.ca] Do you feel you received an unfair grade or want to dispute an academic decision? Review the [LINK: https://www-assets.conestogac.on.ca/documents/www/about/policies/academic-administration/academic-dispute-resolution-and-appeal-procedure.pdf] , Do you require legal advice regarding housing, employment or academic institution disputes? Through CSI you have access to free legal counsel via the [LINK: https://studentcare.ca/rte/en/IHaveAPlan_CSI_Legal_LegalProtection] program. In need of an elevated level of support? Connect with the [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/careteam] Do you have concerns for unwanted sexual conduct or comments, or other issues related to Sexual and Gender Based Violence? – See resources from our [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/sgbv] Drop-ins & FAQs Have questions about your Student Rights and Responsibilities? Join us on Wednesdays from 2pm-4pm on Zoom for brief consultations on college policies, understanding your rights, and finding resolutions. Concerns that require more in depth support and conversations will be directed to book a meeting with a member of our team. For additional questions, check out our FAQs. These policies and procedures guide your academic progression and determine your eligibility to graduate. Since your success is important to us, we want to help you understand how important these policies are and how they will impact you. Check your Academic Program Handbook Progression Requirement Guide for more on weighted averages and progression requirements. Teach-Me-Tech Library Services offers a range of technology supports for students online, to help you learn how to use tech more effectively. You can: Book a 40-minute tech how-to consultation - more details below! Access online tutorials and guides from our [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/digital-skills] [LINK: /s/teach-me-tech/appointments] Tech how-to appointments are available for: introductory      computer skills scanning      and uploading documents to eConestoga navigating MyConestoga, eConestoga, eTexts and other college applications using      Zoom and Teams troubleshooting      software issues instructions installing Conestoga-provided software for PC and Mac using      Microsoft Office 365 products using      collaboration and creativity tools When attending your appointment, make sure you: Come prepared      with details and questions about your tech issue Arrive on time. We will only wait 10 minutes, after which you forfeit your appointment. Please note you will only see appointments if you are a student eligible for service. no appointments are currently available. [LINK: /s/teach-me-tech/appointments] ​Useful online tools and workshops [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/digital-skills] Learn to use Zoom, Office 365, video production and other computer skills. [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/linkedIn-learning] Access a large range of professional instructional videos and online courses to help enhance your software, IT, design and technology skills. [LINK: https://conestoga.campuslabs.ca/engage/organization/teachmetech/events] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-engagement/experiences/skills/providers?page=0] Attend an online Teach Me Tech workshop. We cover a range of topics related to Office 365, Adobe Acrobat and more. ​Tech how-to consultation guidelines We do not assist with assignments, but we will provide examples and resources to guide you in mastering new concepts. We do not handle repairs or software installation. Appointments are 40 minutes and available on a first-come, first-served basis. Appointments are based on staff availability and are not guaranteed. Appointments must be made at least two days in advance and not more than one week in advance. You can access up to one appointment per week. Please ensure you cancel or reschedule your appointments with 24 hours or more notice. If you fail to do so it will be marked as a missed appointment. Frequently missed appointments may impact your ability to self-book service appointments in the future. If you do not arrive within the first 10 minutes of your appointment, your appointment will be marked as missed.

Testing Services We are focused on facilitating the academic success of all students, with a priority placed on ensuring that those requiring testing accommodations receive them in a convenient, accessible, and respectful manner. If you have any questions, you can contact us by emailing [LINK: mailto:TestingServices@conestogac.on.ca] or calling 548-889-0130, choosing option #1 and select your campus. Accommodated Tests Students with approved accessibility accommodations related to testing through Accessible Services have the option to write with their campus Test Centre. Students may request an appointment through the Test Centre section of [LINK: https://conestogac-accommodate.symplicity.com/] . It is the student's responsibility to keep track of upcoming test dates and to book tests 7 days in advance (or 14 days for any tests occurring the week before Student Success week and the last week of the Fall, Winter and Spring semester). Please refer to the following video of how to request a testing appointment in Accommodate: [LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OtWmC6ALb3c] If you are experiencing difficulties submitting your request, please contact us. Booking Procedures for Accommodated McMaster BScN Tests Student      completes Section 1 of the [LINK: https://cms.conestogac.on.ca/sites/virtual-learning-commons/student-success/OpenAccess/book%20a%20test/mcmaster-bscn-accommodated-test-booking-form.pdf] and sends the form to their      Program Coordinator (for nursing courses) or Professor (for health &      elective courses) a minimum of 14 days in advance of the test date. Faculty      completes Section 2 of the [LINK: https://cms.conestogac.on.ca/sites/virtual-learning-commons/student-success/OpenAccess/book%20a%20test/mcmaster-bscn-accommodated-test-booking-form.pdf] and sends the form, and any      applicable test files, to the Doon Test Centre. Test      Centre processes requests and sends confirmation emails to Faculty and the      student. Make-Up Tests "Make-up test" refers to tests administered to students outside of scheduled class time due to a conflict or special consideration (e.g., illness). Students must obtain approval from their faculty to write a make-up test. If approved, your faculty may choose to handle the make-up test directly or use Test Centre services. Requests for students to write a make-up test at the Test Centre must come directly from faculty. Writing at the Test Centre Review what you should do before, during and after your assessment: [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/42] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/43] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/44]

Peer Tutoring We offer FREE help with your course content from upper-level students in your program! Peer Tutors provide support primarily with first-year courses in diploma and degree programs. Peer Tutoring starts in week 2 of the term. Students can access up to two peer tutoring appointments per week. Students can have one appointment booked at a time; once the first appointment is completed, students can book a second appointment pending availability. Appointment times are subject to Tutor availability. Peer Tutors are upper-level students who have previously taken the course. Peer Tutoring support is available for specific courses each term - not all courses are supported. Questions? Please contact [LINK: mailto:peerservices@conestogac.on.ca] . Looking for after-hours help with Accounting, Economics, Finance, Math or Physics? [LINK: https://landing.brainfuse.com/saml.asp?oauth_consumer_key=226C361D] can help, visit the [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/math] page to learn more! [LINK: /s/tutoring/appointments] If you see the message " all appointments are currently booked ": You are enrolled in a course that has tutoring available, but all current timeslots are booked. Continue to check back daily as new appointment bookings become available. If you see the message " no appointments are currently available ": You are not currently enrolled in a course supported by peer tutoring. Please note you will only see appointments if you are a student eligible for service. no appointments are currently available. [LINK: /s/tutoring/appointments] What type of support can a peer tutor provide? Peer tutors can: Clarify course content. Work through example questions. Provide study tips and strategies. Suggest helpful resources. Peer tutors cannot: Support with anything that is being evaluated or submitted for marks (including assignments, quizzes, projects, etc.). Do your homework for you. Re-teach the course content. Peer tutoring is not a substitute for going to class. Cover content that has not yet been introduced in your class. Answer questions outside of appointment times. What can I expect at a tutoring session? Before your appointment, review the content (lecture notes, textbook readings, etc.) you would like to cover in your appointment. When you come for your appointment: Arrive on time (tutors will only wait 10 minutes) Bring your course materials, class notes, textbook or practice material Be prepared with questions that you want to ask your tutor Be ready to actively participate in the peer tutoring process. Tutors will ask lots of questions and support you in using your class resources to find the answers. Tutors may not have all the answers to your questions; therefore, some questions will need to be directed to your instructor. Additional peer tutoring guidelines Tutoring is not guaranteed for any course in any program. Students can book appointments up to 10 minutes before the schedule time. Appointments are available on a first-come, first-served basis and are based on tutor availability. Students can access up to two hours of peer tutoring per week, having only one appointment booked at a time. Interested in becoming a peer tutor? Eligible students must have achieved a minimum grade point average (GPA) of 3.5 in their first year of study. When the hiring process opens, peer tutor positions will be posted on the [LINK: https://mycareer.conestogac.on.ca/home.htm] . Students recommended by their program coordinator will be emailed directly by the peer services coordinator.

Math Services We offer FREE help with course content from our math consultants! Math consultants provide support for students in full-time Conestoga programs who have classes with course codes beginning with "MATH" or "STAT." Appointments are available from 9 am to 4 pm, Monday to F riday Appointments are subject to availability. Students can access one 50-minute math help appointment per week. Math consultants are full-time Conestoga staff with professional math backgrounds. Questions? Please contact [LINK: mailto:mailto:LearningServices@conestogac.on.ca] . Math resources [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/10] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/12] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/9] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/11] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/13] [LINK: /s/math/appointments] If you see the message " all appointments are currently booked ": You are enrolled in a course that offers math help, but all current timeslots are booked. Continue to check back daily as new appointment bookings become available. If you see the message " no appointments are currently available ": You are not currently enrolled in a course supported by math help. Please note you will only see appointments if you are a student eligible for service. no appointments are currently available. [LINK: /s/math/appointments] How to prepare for a math help appointment Before your appointment, review any content you would like to cover during your appointment (lecture notes, textbook sections, etc.) When you arrive at your appointment: Arrive on time. If you are more than 10 minutes late, you will be marked absent and need to reschedule. Come prepared with specific questions for the math consultant. Have your textbook, course notes, calculator or other course materials available for your appointment. How can a math consultant help me? Math consultants can: Clarify course content Work through examples Provide study tips and strategies Suggest helpful resources Math consultants cannot: Help students with material that has not yet been taught in class. Help with any material submitted for marks, like assignments, quizzes, tests, projects, etc. Teach an entire topic. Math help is not a substitute for going to class. Math help appointment guidelines Students can book a math help appointment up to seven days in advance. Students must book appointments with at least two hours' notice. Appointments are 50 minutes in length. Appointments are available on a first-come, first-served basis. Students can access one math help appointment a week. Exceptions may apply. Students can bring up to three other classmates to their appointment. Students can cancel appointments up to six hours in advance through their upcoming appointments page. For cancellations within less than six hours, please email [LINK: mailto:mailto:LearningServices@conestogac.on.ca] . Simply Math [LINK: https://landing.brainfuse.com/saml.asp?oauth_consumer_key=226C361D] Simply Math is an online tutoring resource that will provide you with just-in-time support after hours and on weekends. Access a live tutor to get immediate help with Accounting, Economics, Finance, Math or Physics. Live Tutors are available: Monday to Friday: 5 PM to 11:59 PM Saturday & Sunday: 12:01 AM to 11:59 PM

Writing & Citing As of July 17, 2025, appointments and drop-ins with Writing Consultants are no longer offered. For resources to help support your learning with writing, please see the resources below Writing tutorials We offer a series of self-guided [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/writing-guide] to help you enhance your writing skills and your understanding of proper reference and citation styles. Grammarly Students have access to [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/grammarly] , an AI-powered digital writing assistant. Grammarly’s software helps improve spelling, grammar, tone and style by analyzing writing and providing recommendations and explanatory notes.

Research Services Library Services offers online supports and resources to help with your research assignments. You can: Book a 40-minute research consultation Contact us through our [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/ask-us/chat-text] Visit the [LINK: https://library.conestogac.on.ca/] for access to all our research resources What happens at a research consultation? Library staff can: Help with the development of your topic and subtopics that will guide your research. Recommend online resources (e.g. article databases, eBooks) for your research and demonstrate how to use these effectively. Help you learn how to assess what is credible information. Answer questions you have related to citing and referencing (e.g. APA). Please note: We do not assist with writing or proofreading your work. We will also not select resources for your research paper. [LINK: /s/research/appointments] Make sure you come prepared with a copy of your assignment details, questions, research topic or statement, etc. Arrive on time. We will only wait 10 minutes, after which you forfeit your appointment. If no appointments are available that fit your schedule, [LINK: mailto:cwoodley@conestogac.on.ca?subject=Requesting SSP Research Appointment] . Include your full name, student number, and your preferred meeting time and we will try to accommodate your request. Please be advised that our staff are only available Monday to Friday, 8:30 am - 4:00 pm ET, and that we book appointments no further than one week in advance. Please note you will only see appointments if you are a current student. 8 appointments still available. [LINK: /s/research/appointments] Research consultation guidelines Appointments are 40 minutes and available on a first-come, first-served basis. Appointments are based on staff availability and are not guaranteed. Appointments must be made at least two days in advance and not more than two weeks in advance. You can access up to one appointment per week. Please ensure you cancel or reschedule your appointments with 24 hours or more notice. If you fail to do so it will be marked as a missed appointment. Frequently missed appointments may impact your ability to self-book service appointments in the future. If you do not arrive within the first 10 minutes of your appointment, your appointment will be marked as missed. [LINK: https://ca.libraryh3lp.com/chat/conestoga@chat.ca.libraryh3lp.com?skin=15491] Library staff are [LINK: https://ca.libraryh3lp.com/chat/conestoga@chat.ca.libraryh3lp.com?skin=15491] . We can help you do research, find resources, and reference appropriately. Online research resources Library Services has an amazing number of digital resources available to the Conestoga community. [LINK: http://lib.conestogac.on.ca/books] [LINK: http://lib.conestogac.on.ca/magazines-journals-news] [LINK: http://lib.conestogac.on.ca/videos] [LINK: http://lib.conestogac.on.ca/images] [LINK: http://lib.conestogac.on.ca/standards-codes] Browse more [LINK: https://library.conestogac.on.ca/browse/find-resources-by-type] and [LINK: https://library.conestogac.on.ca/browse/find-resources-by-subject] Research tutorials Library Services offers a [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/research-skills-tutorials] that you can access anytime, anywhere. These tutorials help guide you through the research process when a staff member is not available or if you prefer to work independently.

Learning and Study Skills Learning and study skills build the foundation for academic success in your college program. Learn how to manage your time, read, take notes and study effectively using the information and tools below. Workshops & Events Learning & Study Skills workshops are available to all students throughout the semester to help you improve your academic skills (no referral is required. Workshops available this semester include: Getting Organized Learning and Studying Reading and Note-taking Studying for Exams Slay the Procrastination Dragon Thrive Workshop Series Visit the [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-engagement/skills/providers] to register today. [LINK: /s/learningstudyskills/appointments] ALL students can access drop-ins - click [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/learningstudyskills/appointments/app/?workGroupIds=4,16&siteId=9] now to see the upcoming drop-in schedule One-on-one Learning Skills advising is a referral-based service. If you are looking for support with time management and study skills, connect with a Student Success Advisor through the [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/form.aspx?id=3652170] form. See our [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/docs/Detail/277] about Learning Skills appointments. If you do not see a One-on-one appointment available to book, it may mean you have not been referred to this service or, if you do have a referral for learning skills advising, that all current appointment times are booked. Co-operative Education Co-operative Education can help you develop the tools you need to find your work term, including: Assistance with job search strategy, interview preparation and resume and cover letter writing Posting work term employment opportunities on [LINK: https://mycareer.conestogac.on.ca/home.htm] Evaluating potential workplaces as suitable for co-op work terms Coaching and advising you on the labour market Contact us at [LINK: mailto:co-op@conestogac.on.ca] [LINK: /s/co-op/appointments] Need some help with your resume? Your job search? Have a question about work terms or CEPR? Book an appointment below to speak with your program Co-op Advisor for assistance. If there are no appointments available, please email your co-op advisor directly or contact us at [LINK: mailto:co-op@conestogac.on.ca] . Include your full name, student number, program, and the career or employment help you require. Please note you will only see appointments if you are a student eligible for service. no appointments are currently available. [LINK: /s/co-op/appointments] Co-op Education Preparation Course (CEPR) The Co-op Education Preparation course (CEPR) is required for all students admitted to the Conestoga co-op programs. After completion of this course, co-op students will have an understanding of: Resumes Cover letters Interviewing Co-op workplace readiness Job Search Connect with us for help with your job search including industry contacts, recruitment and selection and curating ideal co-op experiences for your field of study. We can also assist you with: Navigating MyCareer job postings Marketing your skills      effectively through tailoring to job postings Interview Coaching and      preparation Work Term Co-op Work Terms are paid, related industry-specific opportunities. Connect with your Co-op Advisor to discuss: Work Term readiness and      making a great impression Issues or concerns Work Term reporting or Work Term questions Resources Looking for more information to help you explore your co-op education experience? Check out our [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/career/resources/search/?order=Relevance&topicsUseAnd=true] to learn more about career pathways, resumes, interviewing, safe job search and much more! Not sure who your  placement officer/contact is? Medical Clinic Physical and mental health care have a big impact on your college experience. The Medical Clinic offers a variety of health services to support your well-being. [LINK: https://npao.org/about-npao/what-is-a-np/] , physicians and nurses are available for Conestoga students with OHIP, CIHIP (Conestoga Student Health Insurance Plan), or other health insurance plans. Effective Monday January 15 th , 2024, prenatal care services will no longer be offered in the Medical Clinic. Students who are pregnant are advised to go to a local walk-in clinic for prenatal care.  If you live in Waterloo or Kitchener, here is a [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/26] that you can visit. If you live outside of Waterloo or Kitchener, you can find your nearest walk-in clinic or urgent care center by searching “ walk-in clinic near me” on your preferred internet browser. Students who are pregnant and experiencing abdominal pain, bleeding, severe vomiting, or other urgent concerns are advised to go to [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/25] . Services offered Services we offer include: Diagnosis and treatment of medical conditions. Sexual health care, STI testing and treatment. Birth control, IUD insertions and medical abortions. Transgender and gender-affirming care. Mental health care. Referral to specialists. Prescription medication. Immunizations and TB skin testing. Lab services. Wound care and first aid. [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/50] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/50] When and where should I go for medical care? You can contact the Medical Clinic first for any health concerns you have.  Our clinic offers same-day and next-day appointments for urgent illness and injuries. [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/26] You should go to a walk-in clinic if the Medical Clinic is closed, and your medical concern cannot wait until the next day.  Minor illness and injuries include fever, infection, cuts that may require stitches, joint sprains, vomiting, urinary tract infections, cough, sore throat or ear pain. [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/26] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/25] You should go to a local emergency room if you have a life-threatening medical emergency.  A potential life-threatening medical emergency includes severe chest pain, difficulty breathing, sudden numbness or weakness, sudden inability to see, walk or talk, severe abdominal pain, broken bone, head injuries, sudden confusion, or active plan to hurt yourself or others. [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/25] Other Mental Wellness Resources [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/counselling] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/peer-mental-wellness] Good2Talk for free and confidential telephone or text support. Dial 1-866-925-5454 to talk or text GOOD2TALKON to 686868 For immediate emergency support: If you are experiencing thoughts of suicide, call 988 or go to the nearest emergency room. When on any campus, go to security or call 519-748-5220 ext. 5555 When off campus: HERE 24/7 (KW, Cambridge, Guelph): Call 1-844-437-3247 Crisis Services Canada : Call 1-833-456-4566 Call 911 or go to your local hospital’s emergency department How do I book a Medical Clinic appointment Medical services are available to currently enrolled students who are living in Ontario by appointment only.  Walk-in appointments may be available but are not guaranteed. In-person appointments are available [LINK: https://studentsuccess.conestogac.on.ca/myWellness/Contact] . To book an appointment: Call 519-748-5220 ext. 3679 Email [LINK: mailto:mailto:medicalclinic@conestogac.on.ca] from your student email account Visit the Medical Clinic at Doon Campus Room 1A102 Other Resources Conestoga Student Health Insurance Plan The [LINK: http://studentcare.ca/rte/en/IHaveAPlan_CSI_Home] are provided through Conestoga Students Inc. (CSI).  If you have questions, please visit [LINK: https://www.conestogastudents.com/wellness/healthdental/] for details and contact information. International Students In addition to the CSI health care plan, international students also have the [LINK: https://cihip.ca/] .  Please visit [LINK: https://www.conestogastudents.com/wellness/healthdental/] for details. Ontario Resident Students [LINK: https://www.ontario.ca/page/your-health] is Ontario’s health care plan for Ontario residents.  You must present your health card at every medical appointment.

Counselling Services Counselling Services is a safe and private place for a student to meet with a professional Counsellor to address concerns that may be affecting them socially, emotionally, and /or academically. Conestoga's Counselling services are FREE for all students. Conestoga is invested in supporting the health and wellness of our students. Please see the [LINK: https://www-assets.conestogac.on.ca/documents/www/about/policies/student-affairs/student-mental-health-policy.pdf?_gl=1*1a3t1ya*_gcl_au*OTIxMDU5NDc4LjE3NDEwOTYwNTQ.*_ga*MTY4MDAzMTA4My4xNzM2ODAyMzA1*_ga_RN8C0HR85Y*MTc0MjMwMjY2Ny4xLjEuMTc0MjMxMzM5Mi41My4wLjEyOTcyODkyNjI.] for more information. How do I book a counselling appointment? Counselling Services is available by appointment.  Same-day appointments may be available but not guaranteed.  In-person, virtual, and telephone appointments are available to currently enrolled students who are living in Ontario. To book an appointment: Call 519-748-5220, ext. 3679 Email [LINK: mailto:counselling@conestogac.on.ca] Visit the counselling office at the Doon Welcome Centre on the 2nd Floor. Why might I see a counsellor? Here are some of the reasons you may want to see a counsellor: Feelings of loneliness and isolation Transition challenges to adjusting to college and/or living to a new Country Thoughts of suicide and self-harm Feeling anxious, overwhelmed, depressed Dealing with relationship challenges Trauma (i.e., sexual, physical or emotional) Concerns with sleep, diet, managing health related issues Other Mental Wellness Resources Good2Talk: Free and confidential telephone or text support. Dial 1-866-925-5454 to talk, or text GOOD2TALKON to 686868 [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/medicalclinic] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/peer-mental-wellness] For Immediate Emergency Support: If you are experiencing thoughts of suicide, call 988 or go to the nearest emergency room. When on campus , go to security or call 519-748-5220, ext. 5555 When off campus: HERE 24/7 (KW, Cambridge, Guelph): Call 1-844-437-3247 Crisis Services Canada : Call 1-833-456-4566 Call 911 or go to your local hospital’s emergency department What can I expect from counselling You and the counsellor will discuss: What is bothering you. What has helped you deal with past challenges. What are you hoping to be different and/or reduce your stress. What skills and strategies may help you manage your feelings, thoughts and/or situation. Will others know what I discuss in Counselling? No, what you talk about with your counsellor is kept between you and your counsellor. Confidentiality (keeping your information private) is strictly followed. Your information is not shared with your faculty, nor is it shared with immigration. The only time a counsellor needs to let emergency personnel or college Care Team know that you are involved with counselling is if you threaten to harm yourself or someone else.  The counsellor has a duty to keep you and others safe from harm and to involve the appropriate people to help you stay safe.

Peer Wellness Services We offer INFORMAL supportive listening and wellness activities to help support your mental wellness, encourage connection, and learn about resources available to you. Conestoga’s Peer Wellness Services are: Completely FREE Inclusive, engaging, and accessible for all! Drop-in based (meaning you don’t have to book an appointment) Confidential and non-judgemental What is Peer Support? Peer support is a supportive relationship between people who have a lived experience in common. Being a student is complex. Why not talk to someone who has been right where you are now! The Breathing Space The Breathing Space is a wellness-focused, inclusive space for students needing to take a break from their academics, destress, and access tools and resources to support their wellness. Within this space, Peer Wellness Navigators can provide a listening ear and, if needed, direct students to appropriate wellness resources. We encourage students to use the space for their wellness while following the guidelines. Locations: Kitchener - Doon Campus, Welcome Centre Room 104 Intended Use of the Breathing Space Recharge Wellness Space - Students may need a place to escape from the noise and stress of the school environment. The Breathing Space is intended for students to engage in self-care practices and take a break from academic work. Drop-In Activities - Participating in events and drop-in activities can build connections and give students an opportunity to learn about self-care techniques to help with wellness. Peer Wellness Connections - Students can utilize the Peer Wellness Navigators for discussions on supporting their wellness, learning about resources, and connecting with current students in a safe wellness environment. Guidelines for Using the Breathing Space The Breathing Space is intended to support wellness and is not a location to “hang out” or do group work. You may be asked to leave if you are not following the guidelines for use. Avoid Loud or Disruptive Activities - This space is intended for low noise activities. Group work, social hangouts, phone or video calling are not permitted. Disrespectful Attitudes and Opinions will Not be Tolerated - Respect for the space, the staff, and other students is a top priority. Behaviour not allowed includes harassment, crossing boundaries, disrespecting space, hurtful comments, etc. Avoid Attending Online Classes or Meetings . No Sleeping Allowed - While sleep/rest is a fantastic way to take care of yourself, this space is not meant to be a nap room. What is a Peer Wellness Navigator? Peer Wellness Navigators are current Conestoga students who use their lived experience with mental health and/or substance use to focus on building connections and sharing wellness tools, strategies, and resources. Peer Wellness Services are built around mutual respect and trust. No information or services shared in this space are intended to replace clinical wellness services such as counselling and medical. Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified healthcare provider with any questions about your health or wellness if you have any concerns. How to Participate Exploring the activities in The Breathing Space offered by the Peer Wellness Navigators is a great first step to supporting your wellness and becoming connected in an informal way. Looking to participate in a Peer Wellness Navigator activity or group? Check out the [LINK: https://sway.office.com/YXqHECFASd8Nqnhw?ref=Link] to see how you can get involved. For a full list events to support your wellness, check out the SSP’s events page. Stay Connected! The Peer Wellness Navigators share helpful tips to support your wellness on our [LINK: https://www.instagram.com/ccstudentsuccess/] Looking for Mental Wellness Resources? Good2Talk: Free and confidential telephone or text support. Dial 1-866-925-5454 to talk, or text GOOD2TALKON to 686868 [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/medicalclinic] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/counselling] For Immediate Emergency Support: If you are experiencing thoughts of suicide, call 988 or go to the nearest emergency room. When on campus , go to security or call 519-748-5220, ext. 5555 When off campus: HERE 24/7 (Kitchener, Waterloo, Cambridge, Guelph): Call 1-844-437-3247 Crisis Services Canada : Call 1-833-456-4566 Call 911 or go to your local hospital’s emergency department

Sexual and Gender-based Violence Prevention and Support If you have experienced sexual or gender-based violence, we are here to support you. Your [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/student-rights/rights] are recognized and supported at Conestoga College, including the right to be safe. To get support from this service book an appointment by email or call the Sexual and Gender-based Violence Prevention and Support Office directly. [LINK: https://studentsuccess.conestogac.on.ca/myWellness/sexualandgenderbasedviolence] for more details on sexual and gender-based violence, what consent means, how to support others and our privacy and confidentiality information. Questions? Email [LINK: mailto:mailto:sgbv@conestogac.on.ca] or call (519) 748-5220 ext. 3079. [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-engagement/events/search?Text=consent+culture&EventType=&Location=&campus=] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-engagement/events/search?Text=consent+culture&EventType=&Location=&campus=] Book an appointment for sexual and gender-based violence support The Sexual and Gender-based Violence Support Coordinator provides help based on your individual needs. Appointments with this service are confidential. Your timeframe for accessing support is completely up to you. Whether an incident happened recently or a long time ago, you still deserve support! You do not need to disclose what happened in order to get help. You will not be disciplined if alcohol or drugs were      involved. Your international student visa will not be impacted by accessing this service. If you are unsafe or need immediate support on campus, contact [LINK: https://www.conestogac.on.ca/security-services/contact] . If you are off-campus call 911 or visit your local hospital. You can email [LINK: mailto:sgbv@conestogac.on.ca] for and appointment and support.

Wellness & Health Promotion Being a student is complex. To THRIVE, you need to take care of your whole self. This means looking after yourself, especially in the following areas, to set yourself up for success: Stress Management Nutrition & Healthy Eating Sleep Movement & Physical Activity Sexual Health Substance Misuse Supporting yourself when you are feeling well increases your chances of staying well. Explore some of the key areas of your wellness and evidence-based information below. In addition, Student Health & Wellness has [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-engagement/events] to help support your wellness through every step of your student journey! NEW LAUNCH! Check out the [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/docs/225/Recipe-Book-DIGITAL_Jan-2025.pdf] for healthy and affordable recipes! For added stress relief, download the [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/admin/docs/Detail/310] Stress Management Being a student often means balancing many parts of our lives. Being able to recognize signs of stress and learn ways to manage your stress will be crucial to your academic success and wellness! Some ways to manage your stress include time management, [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/docs/Detail/164] , setting realistic expectations, taking care of yourself, practicing self-care, and being proactive! [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/counselling] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/peer-mental-wellness] [LINK: https://www.canada.ca/en/health-canada/services/healthy-living/your-health/lifestyles/your-health-mental-health-coping-stress-health-canada-2008.html] [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/learningstudyskills] Movement & Physical Activity The [LINK: http://csepguidelines.ca/] for adults have recommendations about how much physical activity we need, and the types of activities we should be engaging in. These guidelines include: 150 minutes of physical activity per week Muscle-strengthening activities twice a week Maximum 8 hours of sedentary time per day Conestoga is here to help through the Athletics department. [LINK: https://www.conestogacondors.ca/] for Rec Centre hours, fitness classes and more to help you stay active. Sexual Health Explore ways to ensure you are practicing safe sex, including birth control, STI and disease prevention, and vaccines. The Medical Clinic Team has created a series of videos to provide more information about sexual health. Watch our [LINK: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLF_oevMCyUTiiy99o6pZT1q6K62ESrbyy] . For more information, questions about sexual health or to book an appointment, [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/medicalclinic] . Did you know Conestoga also has a Sexual Health Week every semester? [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-engagement/events?descending=false&page=1&sortBy=Start&studentSiteId=17&text=sexual%20health%20week] . Nutrition & Healthy Eating The foods we eat have a direct impact on how we feel and how we perform at work or in an academic setting. Learning to eat well, meal prep, and cook can be a challenge! To set yourself up for success, we've put together our top tips: Eat lots of vegetables and fruit. Choose whole grain foods. Eat high protein foods. Limit highly and ultra-processed foods. Make water your drink of choice. Additional Resources: [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/docs/225/Recipe-Book-DIGITAL_Jan-2025.pdf] [LINK: https://food-guide.canada.ca/en/] Sleep Did you know: [LINK: https://www.canada.ca/en/public-health/services/publications/healthy-living/canadian-adults-getting-enough-sleep-infographic.html] to feel their best? Learn strategies to improve your sleep: Be consistent. Go to bed at the same time each night and get up at the same time each morning, including on the weekends. Make sure your bedroom is quiet, dark, relaxing, and at a comfortable temperature. Remove electronic devices, such as TVs, computers, and phones, from the bedroom. Avoid large meals, caffeine, and alcohol before bedtime. Get exercise. Being physically active can help you fall asleep more easily at night. Substance Use Get all the facts when it comes to alcohol, cannabis, and other substances. The substances you choose to use might be hurting, more than helping. Knowing the right information to make informed decisions about substance use is an important first step! For more information on substance use, check out the below links. [LINK: https://www.camh.ca/] [LINK: https://www.ccsa.ca/] [LINK: https://www.ccsa.ca/canadas-low-risk-alcohol-drinking-guidelines-brochure] [LINK: http://chrome-extension//efaidnbmnnnibpcajpcglclefindmkaj/https://www.camh.ca/-/media/files/lrcug_professional-pdf.pdf] Looking for more information on how to support your wellness as a student? Join a workshop, event, or activity to learn new ways to add wellness to your everyday routine. Check out the [LINK: https://www.conestogacondors.ca/] and [LINK: https://www.conestogastudents.com/wellness/wellnessoffice/] . [LINK: https://www.instagram.com/ccstudentsuccess/] Book an appointment with [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/counselling] or the [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/medicalclinic] .

Student Engagement Student Engagement connects you with volunteer and learning opportunities to enhance your college experience outside of your academic program. We are committed to welcoming and including all members of our diverse college community through initiatives that allow everyone to develop a sense of belonging and connection. For      general questions related to Student Engagement’s initiatives,      contact [LINK: mailto:studentengagement@conestogac.on.ca] . Co-Curricular Record The Co-Curricular Record (CCR) is an official document, complementary to an academic transcript, which recognizes and records your learning through approved co-curricular experiences at Conestoga College. Search the Student Success Portal Events & Activities page for CCR eligible opportunities. Attend a CCR eligible opportunity to enrich your college experience outside of your program by learning something new and meeting students in other programs. Enhance your portfolio by including your official CCR, signed by the college  Vice-President Students and Dean of Students. How do I find opportunities that I can include on my CCR? How does the CCR support my student experience and my career trajectory? [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/students/infopages/detail/16] [LINK: https://reports.conestoga.unihub.us/ccr/view] What's New and Upcoming Leadership Workshop Series Leadership Workshops are designed to help you develop essential leadership skills necessary to participate effectively in a rapidly changing workforce and world. Collectively, the Leadership Workshops focus on enhancing self-awareness, strengthening core leadership competencies, and inspiring you to become leaders of positive change. Search “Leadership Workshop Series”  on the Events & Activities tab or [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-engagement/events/search?Text=%22leadership+workshop+series%22&EventType=&Location=&campus=] .  Students are eligible to receive Co-Curricular Record (CCR) recognition for participation in each workshop. Volunteer with Student Engagement Are you interested in on-campus volunteer opportunities? Student Engagement and multiple community organizations are [LINK: https://successportal.conestogac.on.ca/s/student-engagement/activities?activityTypeIds=9&page=1&studentSiteId=17] . Volunteering is a great way to make friends, develop professional skill sets and receive cool perks! Educational Resources Want to learn more, but don’t know where to start? Conestoga’s Library has curated a wide variety of resources from its online collection on topics related to equity, diversity, and inclusion. Take a look at these resource guides to continue your learning. [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/anti-racism-racial-justice/home?_gl=1*gxtn52*_gcl_aw*R0NMLjE2NTU5MTQ2NTcuQ2p3S0NBanctOHFWQmhBTkVpd0FmalhMcnRxSDZlV0o2Vmp2RTBvN1JqMXJmTVplNnM2TlFIbXNEaS16Tnlxd3dMTzdQZkZyc1dqUmVob0NwZmdRQXZEX0J3RQ..] [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/lgbtq2?_gl=1*c54ui6*_gcl_aw*R0NMLjE2NTU5MTQ2NTcuQ2p3S0NBanctOHFWQmhBTkVpd0FmalhMcnRxSDZlV0o2Vmp2RTBvN1JqMXJmTVplNnM2TlFIbXNEaS16Tnlxd3dMTzdQZkZyc1dqUmVob0NwZmdRQXZEX0J3RQ..] [LINK: https://lib.conestogac.on.ca/IndigenousResources?_gl=1*c54ui6*_gcl_aw*R0NMLjE2NTU5MTQ2NTcuQ2p3S0NBanctOHFWQmhBTkVpd0FmalhMcnRxSDZlV0o2Vmp2RTBvN1JqMXJmTVplNnM2TlFIbXNEaS16Tnlxd3dMTzdQZkZyc1dqUmVob0NwZmdRQXZEX0J3RQ..] Resources for Students Student Engagement has created lists of college services and community organizations to support the success of African, Caribbean, Black-Identifying, Indigenous, and 2SLGBTQ+ students. If you identify with any of these groups, check out these resources to support your health and wellness, explore arts & culture, and connect with your community.
