Contact – Student Success Portal For assistance with services on the Student Success Portal , please visit the specific service site from the HOME landing page. Each service will have unique contact information and methods that you can use to reach the service directly with your questions.

Conestoga College collects personal information from students under the legal authority of the Ontario Colleges of Applied Arts and Technology Act and ensures the personal information is managed in compliance with the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act in order offer students a comprehensive program of career-oriented, post-secondary education and training. The purpose of the Student Success Portal is to provide students with one shared system that enables students to self-book appointments with a variety of service teams at the College. As such, service teams will create consultation notes for students to review. These may include appointment notes and recommended actions. Students can also access resources and request assistance via forms within the system where to ensure the relevant information can be used to support students in a timely and effective way. Students participating in Events & Activities are acknowledging the sharing of their information for the purposes of tracking booking, attendance and follow-up activities by college services and opportunity providers. Conestoga protects personal information and only discloses it as required by law. If you have any questions, please reach out to [LINK: mailto:privacy@conestogac.on.ca] . By accepting these terms, you consent to the Student Success Portal and the information sharing provisions within it.

Contact – Student Success Portal For assistance with services on the Student Success Portal , please visit the specific service site from the HOME landing page. Each service will have unique contact information and methods that you can use to reach the service directly with your questions.

Conestoga College collects personal information from students under the legal authority of the Ontario Colleges of Applied Arts and Technology Act and ensures the personal information is managed in compliance with the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act in order offer students a comprehensive program of career-oriented, post-secondary education and training. The purpose of the Student Success Portal is to provide students with one shared system that enables students to self-book appointments with a variety of service teams at the College. As such, service teams will create consultation notes for students to review. These may include appointment notes and recommended actions. Students can also access resources and request assistance via forms within the system where to ensure the relevant information can be used to support students in a timely and effective way. Students participating in Events & Activities are acknowledging the sharing of their information for the purposes of tracking booking, attendance and follow-up activities by college services and opportunity providers. Conestoga protects personal information and only discloses it as required by law. If you have any questions, please reach out to [LINK: mailto:privacy@conestogac.on.ca] . By accepting these terms, you consent to the Student Success Portal and the information sharing provisions within it.

Walk-in Clinics Save Send Feedback [LINK: /students/experiences/add/from/infopage/3461120] Walk-in clinics and urgent care centers provide medical care for people who do not have a primary care health provider, or have one but are unable to reach them.  You can see a nurse or doctor without an appointment for minor illness and injuries, but often there is a line or longer wait times.  When you go to a walk-in clinic or urgent care center, you need to bring your College International Health Insurance Plan card (for international students) or your OHIP card (for Ontario residents). If you live in Waterloo or Kitchener, here is a list of walk-in clinics that you can visit: 1. [LINK: http://www.bentonmedicalclinic.com] 51 Benton St, Kitchener 226-240-3014 2. [LINK: http://www.kwmedicalcentre.com] 1360 Weber St E, Kitchener 519-893-6060 3. [LINK: http://www.kwurgentcare.ca/] 385 Fairway Rd S, Kitchener 519-748-2327 751 Victoria St S, Kitchener 519-745-2273 4. [LINK: https://waterlooclinic.com/] 100 The Boardwalk, Kitchener (Walmart) 519-279-4098 5. [LINK: https://www.kitchenerwalkin.ca/] 5 Manitou Drive, Kitchener 519-904-4200 6. [LINK: https://www.wwhealthline.ca/displayservice.aspx?id=101690] 750 Ottawa St S, Kitchener (Zehrs) 519-570-3174 7. [LINK: https://onyxurgentcare.com/] 580 Lancaster St W, Kitchener 519-896-6699 8. [LINK: http://www.sprucemedical.ca] 318 Spruce St, Unit 105, Waterloo 519-725-1111 9. Tannery Medical Centre 120-121 Charles St W, Kitchener 519-618-9260 10. [LINK: https://waterlooclinic.com/] [LINK: https://waterlooclinic.com/] University Shops Plaza II 170 University Ave W, Unit 13, Waterloo 519-725-1514 11. [LINK: https://waterlooclinic.com/] 50 Westmount Rd N, Waterloo 519-954-0111 If you live outside of Waterloo or Kitchener, you can find your nearest walk-in clinic or urgent care center by searching “walk-in clinic near me” on your preferred internet browser. × Feedback Comments Send Feedback Close

Emergency Room Information Save Send Feedback [LINK: /students/experiences/add/from/infopage/3400236] You should only go to an emergency room if you have a life-threatening medical emergency.  There may be longer wait times, especially if your concern is not a life-threatening medical emergency.  When you go to an emergency department, you need to bring your College International Health Insurance Plan card (for international students) or your OHIP card (for Ontario residents). If you live in Waterloo, Kitchener, Cambridge or Guelph, here is a list of the local emergency departments. 1. [LINK: https://www.grhosp.on.ca/care/services-departments/emergency/current-emergency-wait] 835 King St. W Kitchener, ON 2. [LINK: https://www.smgh.ca/patients-visitors/emergency-department-wait-times] 911 Queen’s Blvd Kitchener, ON [LINK: https://www.smgh.ca/patients-visitors/emergency-department-wait-times] 3. [LINK: https://www.cmh.org/programs/department-emergency-medicine] 700 Coronation Blvd Cambridge, ON [LINK: https://www.cmh.org/programs/department-emergency-medicine] 4. [LINK: https://www.gghorg.ca/emergency-department/] 115 Delhi St Guelph, ON [LINK: https://www.gghorg.ca/emergency-department/] 5. [LINK: https://www.haltonhealthcare.on.ca/services_/28763/t28425-emergency-department] Emergency care is available at all three hospitals located in Oakville, Milton and Georgetown If you live outside of these cities, you can find your nearest emergency department by searching “emergency department near me” on your preferred internet browser. Contact – Student Success Portal For assistance with services on the Student Success Portal , please visit the specific service site from the HOME landing page. Each service will have unique contact information and methods that you can use to reach the service directly with your questions.

Conestoga College collects personal information from students under the legal authority of the Ontario Colleges of Applied Arts and Technology Act and ensures the personal information is managed in compliance with the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act in order offer students a comprehensive program of career-oriented, post-secondary education and training. The purpose of the Student Success Portal is to provide students with one shared system that enables students to self-book appointments with a variety of service teams at the College. As such, service teams will create consultation notes for students to review. These may include appointment notes and recommended actions. Students can also access resources and request assistance via forms within the system where to ensure the relevant information can be used to support students in a timely and effective way. Students participating in Events & Activities are acknowledging the sharing of their information for the purposes of tracking booking, attendance and follow-up activities by college services and opportunity providers. Conestoga protects personal information and only discloses it as required by law. If you have any questions, please reach out to [LINK: mailto:privacy@conestogac.on.ca] . By accepting these terms, you consent to the Student Success Portal and the information sharing provisions within it.

Contact – Student Success Portal For assistance with services on the Student Success Portal , please visit the specific service site from the HOME landing page. Each service will have unique contact information and methods that you can use to reach the service directly with your questions.

Conestoga College collects personal information from students under the legal authority of the Ontario Colleges of Applied Arts and Technology Act and ensures the personal information is managed in compliance with the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act in order offer students a comprehensive program of career-oriented, post-secondary education and training. The purpose of the Student Success Portal is to provide students with one shared system that enables students to self-book appointments with a variety of service teams at the College. As such, service teams will create consultation notes for students to review. These may include appointment notes and recommended actions. Students can also access resources and request assistance via forms within the system where to ensure the relevant information can be used to support students in a timely and effective way. Students participating in Events & Activities are acknowledging the sharing of their information for the purposes of tracking booking, attendance and follow-up activities by college services and opportunity providers. Conestoga protects personal information and only discloses it as required by law. If you have any questions, please reach out to [LINK: mailto:privacy@conestogac.on.ca] . By accepting these terms, you consent to the Student Success Portal and the information sharing provisions within it.

Anishnabeg Outreach Volunteer Anishnabeg Outreach is seeking volunteers for their Tutoring and Sports program Volunteer Opportunities Anishnabeg Outreach: 236 Woodhaven Road, Kitchener, Ontario, Canada Save activity Details Background Information: We are a non-profit Indigenous organization that centers reconciliation on healing. For us this looks like having many different programs that are designed to help the urban Indigenous community be able to thrive in their life, such as our spirit bundle program that assists people with accessing free and healthy groceries, and our tutoring and sports program that uplifts Indigenous youth to better their education, learning, and skill development. Our centers are located in both Kitchener and Guelph to help broaden our reach to the community in all cities which includes Kitchener, Waterloo, Cambridge, and Guelph. Responsibilities of this volunteer role include: 1.To guide students through their homework and help the student fully comprehend the intended lesson. 2.To help student build and expand various skills including time management, communication, social, critical thinking, etc. 3.To be a support system for students when they may be feeling overwhelmed or discouraged by education. 4.To help explain opportunities from and through schooling to students so that they may find passions, interests, and pathways. 5.To help supervise and ensure the safety of all students by creating a safe workspace, ensuring students are following safety rules, and communicating thoroughly to the AO Tutoring and Sports team. 6.To help create a fun, productive and supportive workspace through positivity and encouragement, ensuring all students are being respectful of other students, and more. 7.To lead games and activities while students are using the gym space Here is the link to our website that gives more information on the program and where students can register to become a tutor: [LINK: https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Faocan.org%2Ftutoring-program%2F&data=05%7C02%7Cstudentengagement%40conestogac.on.ca%7C468b0cbb8e764bef315508dcf772a994%7C4ddd393ae98a4404841fc4becdd925a5%7C0%7C0%7C638657319154646575%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=qjxNk39MHbPD%2BSg%2BQ0OSYzC9lLM7ObGoy%2BrtJAvWZO8%3D&reserved=0] If you have any questions about the opportunity, please contact: Athena Moffatt <athena@aocan.org> Student Engagement shares information with students about off-campus co-curricular opportunities to support their social and professional development. It is important to note that this off-campus co-curricular opportunity is not affiliated with Conestoga College or the Student Engagement Department. Students participate in this opportunity at their own risk and are encouraged to research and assess any potential risks involved. For any additional questions or support, please reach out to Student Success at ccr@conestogac.on.ca [LINK: /s/student-engagement/activities/GoToUrl/4777137] Other information Type [LINK: /s/student-engagement/activities/Type/9] Commitment Ongoing Expires 28 Oct 2025 Posted 28 Oct 2024 Providers [LINK: /s/student-engagement/organisations/Detail/2331988] Primary Skills [LINK: /s/student-engagement/skills/providers?skillIds=1] [LINK: /s/student-engagement/skills/providers?skillIds=5] Secondary Skills [LINK: /s/student-engagement/skills/providers?skillIds=3] [LINK: /s/student-engagement/skills/providers?skillIds=7]

[LINK: /students/Settings] Description Ready to turn your food business idea into reality? Join us for an inspiring and practical session tailored for aspiring culinary and food entrepreneurs. Whether you’re dreaming of starting a bakery, food truck, catering service, or packaged goods brand, this event will walk you through the first steps—especially how to fund your venture. You’ll hear from successful entrepreneur Lenore Johnson , owner of LenJo Bakes , as she shares how she started her business, the funding options she explored, and what she learned along the way. We’ll also cover a range of funding pathways—from grants and loans to alternative models—so you can find the right fit for your idea. Whether you’re still shaping your concept or ready to get started, this session will give you the tools and confidence to move forward. Discover what’s possible—and how to pay for it. Victorian Order of Nurses (VON) Volunteer Every day, VON volunteers help make Canadian communities healthier. If you want to give back to your community by sharing your time and caring for others, we have a role for you. Volunteer Opportunities VON Brantford Site: 446 Grey St. Suite 204, Brantford, Ontario, Canada Save activity Details Make a lasting difference in your community- Volunteer with VON  today! Every day, VON volunteers help make Canadian communities healthier. If you want to give back to your community by sharing your time and caring for others, we have a role for you. When you become a VON Volunteer we will match your interests and availability to a volunteer role that’s right for you. We offer the training you need and ensure you are supported through frequent communication – support is always a call away. VOLUNTEER VISITOR Offers support and social interaction to an isolated individual through regular friendly visits at the client’s home or out in the community, encouraging active and independent living. Visits are usually 1 time a week and anywhere from 1-3 hours long. Requirements: 1.Complete application 2.Interview 3.Vulnerable Sector Check (VON reimburses you if there is a fee) 4.Provide two references HOSPICE VISITOR Make a lasting difference in your community- Volunteer with VON  today! Every day, VON volunteers help make Canadian communities healthier. If you want to give back to your community by sharing your time and caring for others, we have a role for you. When you become a VON Volunteer we will match your interests and availability to a volunteer role that’s right for you. We offer the training you need and ensure you are supported through frequent communication – support is always a call away. A Hospice Volunteer will provide emotional support, practical assistance within the bounds of the role as a volunteer and respite help as clients and caregivers face a life-threatening illness, death and bereavement. Hospice Volunteers will provide this support at the client’s home or out in the community. Visits are usually 1 time a week and anywhere from 1-3 hours long. Requirements: 1.Complete application 2.Interview 3.Vulnerable Sector Check (VON reimburses you if there is a fee) 4.Provide two references 5.Must complete the “Fundamentals of Palliative Hospice Care Education” training course (VON registers for you and covers the fee) If you are interested in either of these Volunteer Positions or would like more information, please contact Heather Smith T: 519-759-7750 x 249 M: 519-865-8614 E: [LINK: mailto:heather.smith1@von.ca] W: [LINK: http://www.von.ca/] /en/volunteer [LINK: /StoredFile.aspx?id=34433&fn=Volunteer+Posting+Info.docx] [LINK: /s/student-engagement/activities/GoToUrl/4794954] Other information Type [LINK: /s/student-engagement/activities/Type/9] Commitment Ongoing Posted 28 Nov 2024 Providers [LINK: /s/student-engagement/organisations/Detail/2331988]

Volunteer with the Alzheimer Society The Alzheimer Society offers a multitude of roles to support persons living with dementia and their care partners. Volunteer Opportunities Alzheimer Society, Various Cities, Ontario, Canada Save activity Details The Alzheimer Society offers a multitude of roles to support persons living with dementia and their care partners. Overview of role: The Milton Community is looking to connect volunteers with Persons Living with Dementia. Volunteers are matched with clients and attend social visits within the clients’ home or retirement home. We also offer opportunities for volunteers in an administrative capacity, for events, for programs like Teleconnect, Public Education, and more. See here for more information regarding role categories: [LINK: https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Falzda.ca%2Fvolunteer%2F&data=05%7C02%7Cstudentengagement%40conestogac.on.ca%7C12f7a2f5fb1c4be30b4508dcee14a38e%7C4ddd393ae98a4404841fc4becdd925a5%7C0%7C0%7C638647019640831242%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=7MmN2QNIlgxrIdTIUurnDxVNDH%2F78%2Fqm4m6F7UJbGFU%3D&reserved=0] Application Process: The Volunteer Application can be found here: [LINK: https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Falzda.ca%2Fvolunteer%2F%23volunteer-application&data=05%7C02%7Cstudentengagement%40conestogac.on.ca%7C12f7a2f5fb1c4be30b4508dcee14a38e%7C4ddd393ae98a4404841fc4becdd925a5%7C0%7C0%7C638647019640856815%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=%2B%2Fk2rIcpaccqqQ%2B9%2FjNUYlJDXZk0tYfrolAsspyDuWg%3D&reserved=0] *Please note that our volunteer opportunities are open to all ages. Volunteers under the age of 18 may need a parent / guardian present if they are volunteering in a client facing role (i.e., IHSR, Teleconnect.) Once the Volunteer Coordinator in your region receives your application, they will reach out to schedule a virtual interview. Interviews are 30 minutes long. We will then provide a reference form, and volunteers should have two references fill this form out. Once we receive your references, you will be invited to attend a Volunteer Orientation. Finally, upon completion of the Orientation, you will begin your training (i.e., Dementia education, role specific training, etc.) At this stage, we will also match you with your volunteer position. Contact: For any Halton volunteers (Milton, Georgetown, Burlington, and Oakville) applicants can reach out to Sabanta Noor at 289-837-2310 ext. 320.  If the applicant is looking to volunteer in other regions, they can contact our general volunteer email [LINK: mailto:volunteers@alzda.ca] Student Engagement shares information with students about off-campus co-curricular opportunities to support their social and professional development. It is important to note that this off-campus co-curricular opportunity is not affiliated with Conestoga College or the Student Engagement Department. Students participate in this opportunity at their own risk and are encouraged to research and assess any potential risks involved. For any additional questions or support, please reach out to Student Success at ccr@conestogac.on.ca [LINK: /s/student-engagement/activities/GoToUrl/4769400] Other information Type [LINK: /s/student-engagement/activities/Type/9] Commitment Ongoing Expires 30 Oct 2026 Posted 17 Oct 2024 Providers [LINK: /s/student-engagement/organisations/Detail/2331988] Primary Skills [LINK: /s/student-engagement/skills/providers?skillIds=3] [LINK: /s/student-engagement/skills/providers?skillIds=4]

Volunteer with the Learning Disabilities Association of Wellington County Help build a community where learning disabilities are understood and accepted Volunteer Opportunities 218 Silvercreek Pkwy N, Guelph, Ontario, Canada Save activity Details The [LINK: http://The LDAWC was founded in 1973 out of a need to provide familial support, outside of the school system, for those affected by learning disabilities and ADHD. Our mission is to improve the lives of children, youth and adults with learning disabilities so that they can reach their full potential. We do so by prioritizing high-quality programming, resources, and educational events. Our vision is to continue building a community where learning disabilities are understood and accepted.] was founded in 1973 out of a need to provide familial support, outside of the school system, for those affected by learning disabilities and ADHD. Our mission is to improve the lives of children, youth and adults with learning disabilities so that they can reach their full potential. We do so by prioritizing high-quality programming, resources, and educational events. Our vision is to continue building a community where learning disabilities are understood and accepted. Reading Rocks: A one on one tutoring program to help youth who need literacy support. The LDAWC is looking for enthusiastic, committed, motivated people who would like to be positive role models. You must also have excellent oral and written English language skills, as Reading Rocks is a reading/literacy program. Volunteer with Scouts Canada (Cambridge) Volunteering with ​Scouts Canada is fun, flexible and fulfilling Volunteer Opportunities Scouts Canada, Cambridge, Ontario, Canada Save activity Details Volunteer Role Overview Volunteering with [LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VqvIkK96XbY] is fun, flexible and fulfilling. You will be supported by a team of dynamic volunteers who get as much fun out of Scouting adventures as the youth they support. We provide the training and adventure. You provide the enthusiasm. There are multiple ways in which you can contribute as a volunteer, whether you would prefer a more administrative role, to share a specific skill you have or to support youth more directly. The commitment in time may also vary depending on your schedule and your role. The Perks Of Volunteering Develop valuable skills that help you achieve personal and professional goals while challenging yourself. Complete thorough online and experiential learning in understanding youth, program planning, leadership and safety training. Allow more young people to experience all the benefits that Scouting has to offer. Scouts Canada Background Our [LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JEgw7A-RqAo&t=4s] : To help develop well-rounded youth, better prepared for success in the world. Scouts Canada is the country’s leading co-ed youth organization, offering programming for children and youth aged 5-26. With over 50,000 youth participating across the country, in multiple languages and reflecting Canada’s multicultural landscape, kids and youth in Scouts chart their own path of discovery. Through a variety of fun experiences, outdoor adventures and contributions to their community, Scouts builds resilience and skills that set them up for life. Youth in Scouts are supported by a dedicated team of over 12,000 volunteers who collectively donate over two million hours of their time, providing youth with the opportunity to grow, to challenge themselves and to experience countless firsts. Our volunteers help us bring our vision of youth making meaningful contributions to creating a better world to life by lifting people, communities and neighbourhoods.  Scouts Canada is part of the World Organization of the Scout Movement (WOSM) which has over 40 million members in 167 National Scout Organizations around the world. Overview of the Application Process Youth safety is at the core of everything we do. As Canada’s largest youth organization, Scouts Canada places great importance on creating a fun and safe environment for all our members, especially children and youth. We truly believe we have a responsibility to help make Canada safer for our children and youth. This is why adults appointed to positions of authority over youth undergo a vetting process which includes; an application form, interview, police record checks (including vulnerable sector searches), references and youth protection training with Respect in Sport. This process is designed to ensure that Scouters are suitable to occupy a position of trust, and to support this we have a detailed code of conduct as well as our Two Scouter rule which requires for two registered Scouters to be with youth at all times. How to get involved How to get involved To Volunteer or With Questions Contact local (Cambridge) Scouter James Miniotas at [LINK: mailto:james.miniotas@scouts.ca] or by phone 226-581-1474. Volunteer with Grand River Community Health Centre Community based primary health care and offers a range of services to support the emotional, physical and social needs of individuals and communities Volunteer Opportunities Grand River Community Health Centre, Brantford, Ontario, Canada Save activity Details Grand River Community Health Centre provides community based primary health care and offers a range of services to support the emotional, physical and social needs of individuals and communities.  The Centre opens channels between the health sector and the broader community.  GRCHC creates opportunities to work together to achieve equity, a sense of belonging, health and wellbeing for all. Grand River Community Health Centre is proud to serve Brantford and the County of Brant since the beginning vision in 2005! Vision A community where we work together to achieve equity, belonging, health and wellbeing for all. Mission We promote healthy communities by providing primary health care, health promotion and community development, to ensure that no one faces barriers to health and well-being. Values Inclusive - We champion inclusivity through acceptance, welcoming of diversity and fostering a sense of belonging. Collaborative - We work as a team with our clients and partners to provide coordinated care for our community. Accessible - We strive to address the wide range of barriers to accessing services, which clients may face. Respectful - We are inclusive, non-judgmental, compassionate and caring. Equitable - We strive to ensure that people in our community are treated fairly. Opportunities Greeter-Refreshment volunteer positions This opportunity will provide helpful, supportive and friendly assistance to the visitors and clients at Grand River Community Health Centre (GRCHC). Responsibilities Include: Stock refreshment cart with the supplies provided      and set up front screening desk Greet and welcome visitors and clients in a      friendly manner Screen all clients and ensure infection prevention      and control procedures are being followed Direct visitors and clients as needed Meet visitors at front door and bring refreshments      (soup/baked goods/oatmeal/hot beverage) or snack bag Collect visitor/contractor information and track      refreshments distributed Provide information on local resources (aka food      bank) and provide conversation if time permits Escort visitors if requested to the needed services      within the health centre Clean up area around cart and return to the kitchen Stock the cart for the next day Administrative Volunteer This opportunity will give the chance to enhance your administrative skills and allow you to expand your knowledge while helping complete essential office tasks. Responsibilities: The Administrative Support Volunteer will: Scan documents File documents Complete data entry Make client phone calls Other project based opportunities as required Gender Journey Brant Peer Facilitators The successful candidate will facilitate the Gender Journey Brant peer support group. The role of the peer facilitator is to provide peer support to Trans and gender non-confirming identified adults in the Brantford, Brant area.  This position is an opportunity to become more engaged in and support the Trans, and gender non-conforming community in Brantford/Brant. Responsibilities Include: The Gender Journey Brant Peer Facilitator will: Organize      bi-monthly peer support groups Ensure      the group norms are adhered to at all times Provide      peer support to members of the trans community of Brantford/Brant Attend      volunteer orientation and role specific training Opportunity      for other duties 2SLGBTQ+ Community Connections Peer Facilitators The successful candidate will facilitate the 2SLGBTQ+ Community Connections Group. The role of the peer facilitator is to provide leadership and support to the 2SLGBTQ+ community in the Brantford, Brant area. This position is an opportunity to become more engaged in and support the 2SLGBTQ+ community in Brantford/Brant. Responsibilities Include: The 2SLGBTQ+ Community Connections Peer Facilitator will: Organize      bi-monthly peer social groups Ensure      the group norms are adhered to at all times Attend      volunteer orientation and role specific training Opportunity      for other duties How to get involved How to get involved We offer two options for the application process. Online application via Better Impact Platform Review our      current volunteer opportunities by visiting [LINK: https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgrandriverchc.ca%2Fen%2Fget-involved%2Fcurrent-volunteering-opportunities.aspx&data=05%7C01%7CCkeays%40conestogac.on.ca%7Cae7f6fb78e644b7d649f08dbb3aef6ed%7C4ddd393ae98a4404841fc4becdd925a5%7C0%7C0%7C638301336302784963%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=fTfdCT4VbOlBJM8cADtKhh%2Fvo9addFePNxi9qMpbu7g%3D&reserved=0] . On our      website you will find a link for the [LINK: https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapp.betterimpact.com%2FApplication%3FOrganizationGuid%3D7d7c066a-9f07-439d-a0e4-1c2a77c3034f%26ApplicationFormNumber%3D1&data=05%7C01%7CCkeays%40conestogac.on.ca%7Cae7f6fb78e644b7d649f08dbb3aef6ed%7C4ddd393ae98a4404841fc4becdd925a5%7C0%7C0%7C638301336302784963%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=P2bGkfOM85ZdSnIEhrVVNCBdasprmbjt5GCX%2FeQGLKs%3D&reserved=0] that takes      you to Better Impact, our volunteer management platform. Contact – Student Success Portal For assistance with services on the Student Success Portal , please visit the specific service site from the HOME landing page. Each service will have unique contact information and methods that you can use to reach the service directly with your questions.

Conestoga College collects personal information from students under the legal authority of the Ontario Colleges of Applied Arts and Technology Act and ensures the personal information is managed in compliance with the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act in order offer students a comprehensive program of career-oriented, post-secondary education and training. The purpose of the Student Success Portal is to provide students with one shared system that enables students to self-book appointments with a variety of service teams at the College. As such, service teams will create consultation notes for students to review. These may include appointment notes and recommended actions. Students can also access resources and request assistance via forms within the system where to ensure the relevant information can be used to support students in a timely and effective way. Students participating in Events & Activities are acknowledging the sharing of their information for the purposes of tracking booking, attendance and follow-up activities by college services and opportunity providers. Conestoga protects personal information and only discloses it as required by law. If you have any questions, please reach out to [LINK: mailto:privacy@conestogac.on.ca] . By accepting these terms, you consent to the Student Success Portal and the information sharing provisions within it.
